text: Abu Muhammad Sulaiman ibn Mihran al-Asadi al-Kahili (سليمان بن مهران) also known as al-Amash ( الأعمش , 680—765) was a Muslim scholar of the generation of Tabi'un. He was a notable Muhaddith and Qāriʾ. Due to his poor eyesight, people used to call him al-Amash. ==Biography== Al-Amash was born in Kufa in 680 (61 AH). He was a freedman of the Kahil clan from the Banu Assad tribe. His father had moved to Kufa from Damavand, Iran. Al-A’mash died in 764 (147 AH) in Kufa, but most historians say that he died in the month of Rabi al- Awwal 765 (148 AH). His notable students include Abu Hanifa, Ibn al-Mubarak, Sufyan al-Thawri, Sufyan ibn ʽUyaynah and Al-Fuḍayl ibn ʻIyāḍ. ==References== Category:680 births Category:765 deaths Category:7th-century Arabs Category:8th-century Arabs Category:Tabi‘un hadith narrators
title: Sulaiman al-Aʽmash
